In verse 26, the Bible says that the Lord shall be thy confidence. And I said to those young people, I said, how can you make God your confidence? The Lord shall be thy confidence. And I said this, part of the message, it wasn't the entirety of the message, is that the only way God's going to be my confidence, the one that I rely on, the one that I'm trusting, is when I get to know him. And I get to know him through this book. And if the Lord shall be thy confidence, and he's revealed himself to us in the pages of Scripture, and we rejoice this morning because 1 John 5 and verse number 20 tells us that we may know him that is true, and we, notice as it continues, are in him that is true. Think about the truth that we can abide in him. He said in John chapter number 15, abide in me, and I in you. And we can rejoice this morning in the fact that I can abide in him.
